summary: Trailblazing, hell-raising country music legend Tanya Tucker defied the standards of how a woman in country music was supposed to behave. Decades after Tanya slipped from the spotlight, rising Americana music star Brandi Carlile takes it upon herself to write an entire album for her hero based on Tanya's extraordinary life, spurring the greatest comeback in country music history. THE RETURN OF TANYA TUCKER follows Tanya's richly creative, utterly captivating, bumpy ride back to the top as Brandi encourages her to push past her fears to create a new sound and reach a new audience. The writing, the experimenting, and refining of this new music mixes with all that came before -- using rare archival footage and photographs to delve into Tanya's history, beginning in a single wide trailer in Seminole, Texas. Taking stock of the past while remaining vitally alive in the present and keeping an eye on the future, THE RETURN OF TANYA TUCKER is a rousing exploration of an unexpected friendship built on the joy of a perfectly timed creative collaboration.

reviews.content: The problem with this movie isn't Tanya Tucker. She is fabulous. It's the annoyingly self righteous Brandi Carlile. At one point she states that Miranda Lambert wrote ‘The House that Built Me.' Absolutely false. You have to wonder if no one screened this thing. Tanya Tucker is an icon. A legend. Carlile is an opportunist. Who this far has attached her name to a movie in order to move ahead. The fact her wife produced this thing drives that point home further. I hope people can look past this to appreciate the brilliance that has always been Tucker. She's worthy of this movie. Sadly, tacking on someone attempting to be relevant costs this movie quite a bit. Tucker deserved better than this.

I loved Tanya as a child...she's a couple of years older than me. As a young singer/guitarist myself, Tanya made a huge impact on my music. This documentary brought back all the love I had for her and her music but it also brought admiration and pride for her! Thank you Brandi Carlile Carlile for getting  Tanya back on stage. I would love to see it again!
Loved it!  Thanks Brandi!!!  Who is the next resurrection?  Can't wait to see who Brandi resurrects next.  :-))

I love Tanya Tucker and did not understand why they were saying it was a come back. Most of her fans were still there. Now I do. This movie was fantastic. Not showing enough of Layla though! Lol Scooter nice job also!
Very entertaining, and I laughed and was also moved to tears. I  loved the old footage mixed with the new story. The music and dialogue were great.
Exceptional documentary that provided a unique perspective into the creative process for a song and album.
Honest and raw look at a country music legend, Tanya Tucker. Thank you to Brandi Carlisle for giving us this look into her life and struggles.
Oscar worthy for sure. Best Song and Best Documentary.

I loved that it goes all the way back to her early childhood. It showed the good and the bad in her life. She was so brutally honest about her life. I have ALWAYS been a big fan of her music and cried like a baby while loving every moment of her life. Thank you Brandi Carlile and Shooter Jennings for making this happen for those of us who have loved her music from the "get go"! Job well done!

Must see.  Such a beautiful and moving film.  The bond built between TT and Brandi is so moving.  Brandi’s investment and commitment to the artist who came before her is so beautiful.  The music is wonderful.  Just a gorgeous come back capture.

This is a wonderful story that exemplifies the gracious extension of the most generous gift from Brandi who demonstrates that faith and love can heal.  This also shows the challenges of a young country phenom in a turbulent world of music.  Tanya's vulnerability, grit and strength are raw and palpable. I loved it.  Fairly certain Oscar nomination buzz.
It was a documentary not a movie. Pretty boring in most parts.
A beautiful film about the creative process. Watching Tucker and Carlile talk about songwriting is reason enough to go.
I liked seeing that Tanya Tucker is making a comeback
The production was amazing. Singing and story was the best
I didnt know Tanya from childhood. But it was great to learn about her and to see how she created a new album after 15 years of not playing, with the help of other, and to win an Emmy!
